definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
to spread out/to open up/to exhibit/to put into effect/to postpone/to prolong/exhibition

sentences.english: At the flower show I thought of that Christmas card.
sentences.chinese: 在花展上我想到了那张圣诞贺卡。

sentences.english: He was invited to present the prizes at the annual flower show.
sentences.chinese: 他受邀在一年一度的花展上颁奖。

sentences.english: I am watching a flower show with my friend tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 明天我将和朋友一起去看花展。

sentences.english: Even if you don't like flowers, you shouldn't miss the flower exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 即使你不喜欢花，这次花展你也不应错过。

sentences.english: Female North Korean soldiers attend an exhibition of Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia flowers.
sentences.chinese: 朝鲜女兵参观“金日成”花展。

sentences.english: Mum: It’s a lovely day. Let’s go to the flower show.
sentences.chinese: 今天天气很好，让我们去看花展吧。

sentences.english: There is flower show this weekend.
There is a flower show at the time of year in the city.
sentences.chinese: 每年的这个时候这个城市都举行花展。

sentences.english: Can you tell me about the Flower Show?
sentences.chinese: 能给我谈谈花展的事吗？

sentences.english: Three flower shows succeeded one another in quick succession.
sentences.chinese: 三个花展一个个地接连举行。

sentences.english: Even if you are not fond of flowers, you shouldn't miss the flower exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 即使你不喜欢花，这次花展你也不应错过。

sentences.english: Her beautiful roses won second prize at the flower show.
sentences.chinese: 她那些美丽的玫瑰在花展上得了二等奖。

sentences.english: They carried off most of the prizes at the village flower show.
sentences.chinese: 他们在乡村花展上获得了大部分覃辉奖项。

sentences.english: Would you like to go to a flower show with us tomorrow?
sentences.chinese: 你明天想和我们一起去看花展吗？

sentences.english: Her beautiful roses won third prize at the flower show.
sentences.chinese: 例句她那些俏丽的玫瑰在花展上得了三等奖。

sentences.english: I watched her drink in the displays in delicious gulps.
sentences.chinese: 我看到她在花展上将美味的饮料一饮而尽。

definition: variant of 臘梅|腊梅[la4 mei2]
Birthday of the Flowers, spring festival on lunar 12th or 15th February
oriental cherry (Prunus serrulata or Prunus yedoensis), prized for its blossom/also known as sakura (Japanese) or Yoshino cherry
